This pandemic has exacerbated longstanding inequities in our health care system, a system that often falls short for communities of color. As we kick off #NationalMinorityHealthMonth, we must commit to closing these gaps & ensuring every Georgian has access to health care.

My friend @SenAlexPadilla is absolutely right. In Georgia, Black women are *6 times* more likely to die due to childbirth complications. It’s past time we ensure all families can access safe, affordable & unbiased maternal health care. https://twitter.com/SenAlexPadilla/status/1377661095125602306 QT @SenAlexPadilla Black women are dying at alarming rates due to systemic disparities & racial bias in our health care system. We cannot ignore this public health crisis any longer. I’m teaming up with @SenatorWarnock on a bill to invest in our local communities & improve maternal health outcomes.

One of the best parts of the job is coming home to GA & meeting with folks around the state. Yesterday, I traveled across SW GA to learn more about the tremendous work being done by our farmers & producers—thank you for welcoming me with your generosity & hospitality. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/Ex56ikeW8AAiJcg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/Ex56ikeW8AAiJcg.mp4

I urge the Senate to immediately take up and pass this resolution so we can add the ERA as an amendment to the Constitution and finally achieve this landmark accomplishment in the fight for equality.
I stand with women across the United States in demanding this critical legal tool be available to the combat the everyday discrimination we face.

Gender-based discrimination cannot stand – we are all equal and should be treated as such under the law. I was incredibly proud to vote to remove the time limit for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1377658575980523532/pu/img/8CPACvQMpezJtxGh.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1377658575980523532/pu/vid/480x270/eMI85fEHjmkreTCw.mp4?tag=12

and am willing to work with our Democratic colleagues on a thoughtful and targeted approach. But if we’re going to waste our time on another partisan, progressive wish list like the one President Biden proposed yesterday, you can bet I’ll oppose it.

We can’t keep throwing money at our problems as if this were a game of Monopoly. We need to focus on putting the virus behind us, getting folks back to work, and returning our kids to school. I’m in favor of improving our bridges and roads . . .

when we need them the most. Hiking taxes on businesses hurts workers and raises costs for consumers. We saw record wage growth thanks to the 2017 Trump tax cuts, and this is Democrats’ attempt to erase those gains at the expense of American workers.

As it stands now, only 6% of the $2.25 trillion proposed actually goes to fix bridges and roads, while the rest goes to big cities on the coasts and progressive priorities, leaving rural communities behind. As we continue recovering from the pandemic, this proposal will kill jobs

Our country could use targeted investment in infrastructure, but this proposal is definitely not it. Once again, President Biden & Dems are proposing a massive spending bill which is being advertised as an infrastructure package, but is really the Green New Deal in disguise.

I am thrilled to see President Biden recognize that investing in a green future is key to our economic recovery. What we need now is the full resources necessary to make these proposals a reality. Realizing the existential threat that we face, I will push for more investments.

Today, as Michigan and the U.S. begin rebuilding from the economic devastation of the pandemic, President Biden understands that the climate crisis requires nothing less than the U.S. becoming a global leader, and he has offered a solid plan to get us started.

When the Great Recession hit, Michigan bounced back by investing ambitiously in renewable energy, training and employing many tens of thousands of Michiganders in clean energy jobs, turning our state into a national leader.
The #AmericanJobsPlan will help revitalize our economy, create good-paying union jobs and ensure cleaner air and water for our communities.
